outputs.output_descr: The demand for disarmament, demobilization and reintegration (DDR) of ex-combatants in post conflict settings is increasing, particularly in non-peacekeeping contexts where UNDP often plays a leadership role. The UN approach to DDR is changing, as departments, agencies and funds work to increase their coordination and effectiveness on DDR. UNDP has played a significant role in recent developments and is well positioned to play a central role in the future of DDR within the UN system. This project document identifies likely future trajectories for UN engagement on DDR and proposes the nature and scope of future UNDP, in particular BCPR's, engagement on DDR. It further outlines the resources and activities required to achieve that goal.
UN INTER-AGENCY WORKING GROUP ON DISARMEMENT, DEMOBILIZATION AND REINTEGRATION

project_title: DDR - Strengthening UNDP Effectiveness in DDR
